storyInfo: While reminiscing with Specter, Amaia catches on to Ulpianus's actions. She must make a sacrifice before the Hunters and the ship's captain can finish off the Seaborn.

attributes.content: Do you remember how we first met, Laurentina?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Badly injured, you lay across the rocks of that snow-like beach, as if you were some kind of sleeping beauty.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: After drifting along the currents for so long, I was finally awoken by some truly rancid land-dwellers. How I wished I could have slept forever.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: How could that be? If I'm remembering properly, we made quite a good first impression on each, didn't we?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: That I won't deny. Otherwise, you would've ended up like Quintus, chopped into itty bitty pieces.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Speaking of, what a damn shame. Why couldn't have I felt like this back at Sal Viento? I could've 'reminisced' with him so much more vigorously.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Amaia maintains her elegant posture. The nethersea brand spreads as far as she can see.
But Laurentina does not take her seriously in the slightest.
What is she looking at?
...Your recovery seems to have gone well.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Thanks to you. What about the other one? How's he doing?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Who knows? Maybe he ended up like Quintus and perished at the hands of a Hunter.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Which one?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: 'Twas just idle chatter.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Originium Arts. True, if there's anything on land that can pose a threat to a Hunter, it would probably be those so-called 'Arts.'
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But you don't seem very well-versed in fighting with Arts either. Aren't you a bit TOO pathetic?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Laurentina, have you never wondered why your consciousness sometimes clears up and sometimes blurs? Or how you can even function after being injected with such a concentrated dose of refined liquid Originium?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Isn't that because I'm built different?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You've also told me about your dance lessons.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Ah, damn it. I can't believe you told me before I got to remember it myself.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Fine, there were dance lessons. What else did I tell you about, Amaia?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Stop changing the subject, Laurentina.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Or, are you saying you know exactly how you 'woke up'?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: We've done many experiments on you, my Sleeping Beauty.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: For the longest time, we could only understand the ocean through the knowledge of the Islanders. And then, a perfect organism appeared right in front of us.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Our methods were primitive at best. Even if we donned the trappings of the church, we could not hide our blemishes as land-dwelling creatures—
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Cases of us embracing the sea were few and far between, and the new lifeforms were seldom stable.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Do you still remember the huge ruckus you made right after waking up, and the first conversation we had after that?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I asked, 'how did the Ægir manage to do it?'
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Amaia dodges Specter's attack.
She gently caresses her neck, and the glow of the golden hall seems to bleach her skin a ghostly pale.
You hold a massive amount of refined liquid Originium... right here.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: If an ordinary person had had their spinal fluid replaced with such a concentration of liquified Originium, they wouldn't be merely comatose, no two ways about it.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I really ought to thank you. After all, you allowed me to experience a completely different life.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Do you know how many Ægirs had their futures forcibly wrenched from them because of the trench-sucking scum you worship?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...And what would you originally have been then? An opera singer? A playwright?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: As if. Of course not.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I wanted to be a sculptor. Even my teacher said I had the talent for it.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: When I was little, the city I lived in had a massive, snow-white statue.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Did it collapse during the Seaborn's invasion?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Nah, that'd be too cliché.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I've never even seen it broken. We moved to a different city before long.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But that statue's always remained in my head, and I never forgot what it looked like. And then... thanks to you guys, I finally understand the allegory of that statue alternating between black and white amidst the shadows.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: 'Prayer.'
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: If I'd continued my studies in Ægir, I might have never learned the more nuanced meaning of that word.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You can stop stalling for time now. I know your arts are related to perception; I've seen them.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Haha, think of it this way. I've met some real weirdos aboard Rhodes Island. I might've done some rather unbecoming things, but... Never mind, I'm sure they'll forgive me.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Is that the name of a ship?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: A much better ship than this one.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Anyway, your precious Sea Terrors are all dead or injured, and your nethersea brand can't do anything but eat away at this pompous hall. What's next?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Need help writing your suicide note? You don't get to see authentic Ægirian calligraphy everyday, you know.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Haha.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Well then, Laurentina.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Amaia extends her hand to Specter. Her slender palms are covered in the nethersea brand, as if she's wearing faintly luminescent formal dress gloves.
Specter does not reject her, but grips her weapon tightly with one hand while holding Amaia's in the other. The two of them step delicately across the golden hall.
Actually, I wasn't much of a dancer when I was young. The captain taught me a few times, much later. She's a better dancer than you.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You know what keeps your Oripathy in check. You also know why it's easier to wake up from your affliction the closer you are to the sea.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The other Hunters, particularly Gladiia, must have guessed it long ago. But she's always been reluctant to admit the truth to herself. It could not be simpler, yet it is so cruel.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Isn't it because I've returned home, and am smitten by the scenery?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Haha. Laurentina, I never realized how much you loved self-deprecating humor.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: But you're not wrong. Returning home. Returning to the sea.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: It's all because their blood flows within you.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The Seaborn part of you is holding back the Originium. The Seaborn part of you is what wakes you up when you return to the ocean.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: So, this awakened you, as you are now. Are you Seaborn, or Abyssal Hunter?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Watch your step.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You aren't expecting to shake me, are you? Like how Skadi got lectured by that talking scum back in Sal Viento?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Are you not shaken? Even though you recognize that your strength, your sanity, and your soul all come from your enemies? No one can remain unperturbed in the face of this truth.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I haven't finished my story yet. Do you know why I love sculpting?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Because, during the process of carving, chiseling, and shaping—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Specter pauses her footsteps.
Amaia is caught by surprise for a moment. Specter releases her hand as her other is already bearing her weapon down. At that moment, her expression glistens with a childlike glee.
—We give meaning to the forms of the dead, liberating them from the void of meaninglessness.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Just like my lovely destiny.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Tch, there's no end to this trash.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What do we do? How are we going to catch up to it? Where is it going?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: They retreat to the ocean when hurt. We don't often hunt them on dry land.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: But— Ugh!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The Sea Terrors managed to breach the hull?! But, even the cannons of high-speed battleships shouldn't be enough to damage the Stultifera Navis!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: They've had years. Must've chipped through it long ago.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...They trapped the ship but didn't sink it? Why?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We can ponder this all we like, but regardless of what miracles it took, we need a plan fast or this ship really is going to sink!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: A plan, huh... That I do have.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Quickly take out the enemy, and they should retreat back to their nest.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Is it really that easy?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: If not, then we make it so.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It's heading up, hurry! We can't let it reach the ocean!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: But... Ugh, Sea Terrors are practically clogging the entire corridor!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Can you still jump?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The roof's been corroded by the nethersea brand and is very fragile.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We'll take a shortcut.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: *hiss*...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: There you are, my quarry.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...You, prey on blood relatives. Prey on kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You, have eaten many.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Well no shit, you think we can live off the wind?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: To consume, is without fault. Food, is plenty.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You, will consume me? You, are inviting me?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Because, information from afar, cannot pass to kin. Language, they do not understand. Vibration of air, utterance of sound, understanding of rules, learning of language.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: This is why I hate those damn Ægirs. Look, even the monsters are learning Ægirian now.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Don't think I'll show you any mercy just because you learned how to talk, scumbag.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...You consume me, I consume you.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Feeding, has continued for too long. Must be ended.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: How quickly time flies, you little runt. All this time, I've watched you grow up.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You think you're the predator?! You're nothing more than my domesticated beast!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Alfonso's blade digs into the Seaborn's body, while its sharp fangs scratch his arm.
Blood splatters through the air, and the atmosphere intensifies. The Seaborn's movements are becoming faster.
Tch, you ruined my last change of clothes. I ought to skin you alive.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Roars) —
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: —Over here!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Ishar—
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: *gurgle*... Ishar-mla... You will, consume.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...Shut up.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You don't need to blather on to kill your prey. We just do our job.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: —Stop it before it jumps into the sea!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Think you can run?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The Seaborn continues to increase its speed, appearing to leave an afterimage of itself in place.
It strides and bounds, and in an instant, is already on the opposite side of the deck. Barely touching the ground, it dives straight into the ocean.
But something else is even faster than it.
A black shadow cuts off its retreat and smashes it to the floor. There, away from the light, something sears a mark into the deck, causing the entire ship to shudder.
My, you're the same type of thing as Quintus, aren't you? If not, half of your body would've been sent flying, not just a little scratch like that.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Next up is—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: —Wait, what's this? This scent...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You felt it. Of course, he no longer is concealing himself, which means he has proven what he wished to prove. He has said what he wished to say.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Alas, I thought he'd be able to understand.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Understand what?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: If this scent belongs to his master rather than something else that's turned into a Seaborn, then I'd suggest giving up on him ever understanding.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Based on what I've seen of your shallow experiences and moral judgments, your idea of a 'trustworthy' Ægir is usually just whoever stands out most.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: (Ulpianus has made his move. In that case, I can't waste any more time with her. There's no more point in stalling.)
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: (I must find the Herald. I must... welcome it.)
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Hm? Leaving so soon? I thought we were just getting started.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Maybe next time, Laurentina.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: If we ever meet again, let's have another chat. About Ægir.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Skadi doesn't blink.
She couldn't be more familiar with these movements. Simple, straightforward, a force of nature.
She remembers how her colleagues at Rhodes Island assessed her, as well as how she assessed the two in front of her, back when she first saw them.
However...
You were all chosen, deemed worthy by Ægir. Under my command, you should've been prodigies of exacting violence, your hunting genes complementing your skills.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But you've regressed, Skadi.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You're...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It's not dead yet, Ulpianus. Don't be in such a rush to patronize Skadi.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I'm aware.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Take heed again, Skadi. Just like before, I'll only teach you once.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: (Screeching howl)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ulpianus swings his weapon.
The strike is straightforward and without excess. It is sufficiently swift, such that the Seaborn cannot avoid it despite its wishes.
Afterwards, an enormous rumbling sound proves that the strike was also sufficiently strong.
By the time the Seaborn is miserably thrown against a turret that's never been fired, its body had already been considerably cut down in size.
Like so. Grasp its movements. Make a decision. Swing your weapon. Aim to kill.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: This is how you fight them. You are slower than before, and more cautious. Your life on land has been no small influence on you.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I... I never thought... but how did you survive?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I thought you died... But you, and Swordfish, how did you two survive?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What about the others then? The 1st Company, and the 4th Company? Did they—
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: By my standards, my survival was a tragedy. The Seaborn told me that the others could not be allowed to live on. They would not have overlooked anything in their nest.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Of course, based on Gladiia's usual attitude, by her standards this was also a disgrace.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Finish it off first. As for your situation, we can wait for all the Hunters to arrive.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You, in this dry, floating vessel... on this ship, hunt. You, left our kind.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Death, does not benefit our kind. Your death, also does not benefit our kind.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Urk—!
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Pah. What kind of hunter talks before his quarry is dead? That's the first lesson we teach in field training.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I seem to always be cleaning up after the messes of you Ægirs.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What is it you want? What do you need with my ship? Look what you did to Iberia, and to Victoria. Letting monsters overrun Ursus...
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Roars) —!
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Urgh, stubborn bastard!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Screeches) ——!
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Run it through! Now, Alfonso!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Take this!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Haah...
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I-Is it over?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Ugh... I can't... feel my hand...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Look out beneath you!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: It's not dead yet!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ... (Blood gurgles in its throat) Grrrgh...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Urgh...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: It chipped through the deck. Trying to jump onto the chopping block yourself, you sack of meat?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...No, not quite.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: After it! We didn't chase it back into the cabin, there are still more of its kin on the ship!
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: It's looking for her!
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...Urgh... *gurgle*...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Chewing sounds) ...Urgh... Kraaahh...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Herald.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Scaleless, kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Wounds, can't be healed. No way, to nourish our kind.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: They all, attack. Attack, but not to hunt.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Amaia simply listens quietly.
The wound Specter left on her slender body continues to bleed, dripping into the pool of blood already shed by the Seaborn and mixing into one.
Amaia simply listens quietly.
...You, also hurt.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You, consume me.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Kin, you live.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Our kind, will continue, and survive.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The Seaborn bows its body, lowering itself at Amaia's feet.
It closes its eyes and awaits death.
Amaia continues to listen quietly.

attributes.text: These sorts of unrequited altruism are respected by humans, and considered virtues.

attributes.content: Ægir. I have never seen that country myself. A vast, vast country, larger than Iberia, Victoria, or Ursus. Or perhaps all three combined.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I've heard that the Ægir are rationalists. But how rational can they be, compared to the rationality of our kin?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Listen to me, Herald.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: There is nothing noble about sacrifice, and dedication is not necessarily a virtue.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Virtue...? Noble...?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You do not need to understand what sacrifice or dedication are. Only the mediocre would presume that the Seaborn becoming closer to humanity is any form of evolution.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: This is merely an increased tolerance to allow for more possibilities.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: When we praise those who selflessly serve their kin, all that means is that so many more have chosen to do otherwise.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: If even young gloompincers will die in the jaws of their natural predators to protect their kind, then why do we feel a need to repeatedly extol such a virtue?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Humans only sing the praises of what's rare, using morality to whitewash altruism. All in an attempt to justify their utilitarian hearts, deeming themselves more noble than beasts.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Such ridiculous self-aggrandizement. It is clear that the cracks between nations and races are tearing this land asunder.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: 'Life has never been without order,' my Herald. This is the final answer I sought, for which I left the land and entered the sea.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The Seaborn closes its eyes. It is contemplating the words of Amaia, the words of its kin.
It does not understand, but its kin says that it does not need to understand, only to do.
The next moment, it feels its scaleless kin place her hand upon its body.
Its kin says:
'I ask of you.'
'Remember me.'
'Set me free.'
'Consume me.'
Amaia!
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: No... The scent is still here. It couldn't have gotten far.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: It cut through the walls corroded by the nethersea brand and returned to the ocean.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But that's not all. Something happened here. Its blood trails disappeared.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...You all stay here. I'll go after it myself.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Why would Hunters be afraid to return to the ocean? This is a disgrace.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Then stew in that disgrace, Gladiia. We need to tread carefully, and I alone will be enough to handle this.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I'll go with you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: To monitor me?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: To maintain discipline.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: As you please. But surely you can feel it too.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: More Seaborn are approaching. This place may be closer to shore, but it's already become the heart of the ocean.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: *brays*...
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: ...Soon, soon— the grand domain.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Very soon.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The storm is tearing the sky open. The terrible waves, they come, they will come.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: We shall watch. We shall wait.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: We shall meet the terrible waves.
attributes.name: The Last Knight
